NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 汽车后部的行李箱
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The small car has no trunk at its back.

NewWords.WordPhrase: have difficulty handling or coping with 费力地对付
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She struggled with the math problem but eventually worked it out.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. (usu.pl) 食品杂货
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This small shop sells some groceries like salt, soy, spice, etc.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 机车
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The factory produces primarily diesel locomotives.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 喇叭
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The driver blew / sounded his horn when an old lady with her dog stepped in front of his car.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. , ad. 附近的；在附近
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She came from a nearby village.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 翘拇指(赞同或满意的表示)
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He held thumbs-up and expressed approval.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 手势;姿势
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. repeat (another's words, ideas, etc.) 重复
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They echoed their leader's every word.

NewWords.WordPhrase: make sb. aware of (sth.) 引起(某人)注意
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The article was intended to draw the public's attention to environmental protection.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. rising or falling sharply 陡峭的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The castle is built on a steep hill.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. (knelt) go down on the knees; rest on the knees 跪下;跪着
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Everyone in church knelt in prayer.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 货物;货运
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This aircraft company deals with freight only; it has no passenger service.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. above one's head; in the sky 在上头的;架空的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She turned on the overhead light and looked around the room.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v.  send (sth. such as a warning or a message) by a light or an act 发信号传达
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We signaled the taxi driver to pull over.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 远离，不碍事
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Step out of the way and let me handle the stone.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. begin again after a pause 重新开始，恢复
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We resumed our work after a rest.

NewWords.WordPhrase: prep. for each 每
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. How much do you earn per week?

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 加速器，加速装置
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. An accelerator is a device for increasing speed.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. (AmE) 列车员
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The conductor announced the name of each station.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. coming halfway between; not extreme 中等的  n. a means which can be used to express or communicate sth. 媒质，媒介
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He is of medium height.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (infml) do things in an aimless way; spend time playing 随意做事;闲荡  mess vt. put into disorder 弄乱;弄脏 n. 混乱
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He often likes to mess around with pals on days off.

NewWords.WordPhrase: int. 嗨(用以唤起注意等)
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Hey! Where are you going?

NewWords.WordPhrase: (cause to) become calmer (使)冷静下来
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She is so angry now. Just leave her to cool down and then talk to her.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. see or recognize 看出，认出
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Thank you for pointing out the error; I hadn't spotted it.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 片刻,瞬息
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He paused for an instant.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. with great attention 专心地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He does his homework intently after school every day.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 破布;抹布; (pl) 破旧衣服
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He was clad in rags.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 制动器，刹车
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His brakes failed on a slippery road.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 用力拉
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The child pulled on his mother's coat wanting to leave.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 使劲，用全力
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She opened the door with all her strength and ran out of the house.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  (汽笛等的)鸣叫
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The driver gave a blast on his horn.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. burst with a loud noise 爆发;爆炸
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The boiler exploded and a big fire ensued.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. (cause to) move or swing slowly from side to side (使)摇动;(使)摇摆
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The trees swayed in the wind.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. move very fast; produce a sudden bright light 飞驰，掠过;闪烁
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The cars flashed past.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. 计算
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The scientists are able to calculate accurately when the spaceship will reach the moon.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 减速
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The harder the brake pedal is pressed, the greater the car's deceleration.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. 呻吟
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The wounded man lay there groaning, with no one to help him.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. extremely loud 雷鸣似的; 极响的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His speech got thunderous applause.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (leapt or leaped) vi. jump 跳，跃
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The dog leapt over the fence.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. seize suddenly; take roughly and quickly 猛地抓取
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He grabbed the coin and ran off.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  刀刃，刀身;刀片
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The blade of the kinfe is very keen.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 松散的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His tie was pulled loose and his collar hung open.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 榔头，锤
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The man picked up the hammer on the ground and hit the statue into pieces.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. fall or strike suddenly, violently, and noisily 突然重重倒下;坠毁;碰撞
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The cars crashed into each other.

NewWords.WordPhrase: stretch one's arm, usu. in order to get or touch (sth.) 伸手抓
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The mother reached out to grab her little boy but it was too late. He fell into the river.

NewWords.WordPhrase: free from, not in contact with 离开;不接触
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. As soon as he was clear of the building he looked round.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. 刮，擦
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Scrape the mud off your shoes with this knife.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. at once; immediately 立即，即刻
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I instantly recognized her.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  前额
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He had a broad forehead.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. hit hard 猛击，用力击
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He punched him on the nose.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 尼龙
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. nylon stockings/a nylon curtain

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 织物，织品;构造，结构
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She bought some fabric to make shirts from.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  great fear or shock 恐惧,震惊
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He was filled with horror at the sight.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 一上一下地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Window cleaners are pulled up and down tall buildings on cradles（吊蓝）.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. harm, hurt; damage 损害;伤害   injury n.
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There were two people injured in the car accident.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. hold tightly in one's arms 紧抱
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He hugged his daughter.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 面具，面罩
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We all wore masks at the party and no one knew who we were.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. that can be seen 看得见的，可见的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The smoke from the fire was visible from the road.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. 转动;（使）扭曲;扭伤
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Twist the lid to open it.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 救护车
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The ambulance is equipped with life-saving equipment.

NewWords.WordPhrase: = madam 女士，小姐
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Can I help you, Ma'am?

NewWords.WordPhrase: prep. by means of; by way of 通过;经过
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We will fly to New York via Alaska.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. BP机，拷机
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A beeper emits a beeping signal when the person carrying it is being paged（寻呼）.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. of or in the inside 内部的;内在的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. the internal relations of things

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. like a miracle 奇迹般地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The soldiers won a victory in battle miraculously.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. （缝合伤口、缝纫、刺绣等的）一针，针脚
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The dress was sewn with small stitches.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. put (sth.) in a dangerous position 使遭受危险   n. 危险，风险
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She risked her own life to help a disabled woman.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (infml) in no way; definitely not 不行;决不
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This remark should no way be taken lightly.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. sth. that happens 事情;事件
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Were there any exciting incidents during your journey?

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. protect; cover 保护;遮蔽   n.  隐蔽处;躲避处
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. That line of trees shelters my house from the wind.
